title: Refactor audit logs to include user-specific metadata fields
summary: Restructure existing audit log schema to incorporate user-specific metadata fields necessary for GDPR compliance. This enables individual user data identification and tracking for erasure requests.

title: Implement log classification system for personal vs operational data
summary: Create a classification system to differentiate between personal data subject to GDPR and operational data that must be retained. This enables targeted erasure while maintaining compliance obligations.

title: Build data lineage mechanism for tracing log dependencies
summary: Develop a comprehensive data lineage system to track dependencies between log entries, enabling complete identification of all data related to a specific user for erasure requests.

title: Create automated RtE request processing system
summary: Build an automated workflow system to handle Right-to-Erasure requests efficiently, including request validation, data identification, and execution of erasure operations in compliance with GDPR timelines.

title: Implement full deletion mode for eligible personal data
summary: Develop functionality to completely delete personal data from audit logs when legally permissible, ensuring no traces remain while maintaining data integrity for non-affected records.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: full deletion and partial redaction modes

title: Implement partial deletion/redaction mode for log entries
summary: Create capability to selectively redact personal information from log entries while preserving operational context and audit trail integrity when full deletion is not possible.

title: Build meta-logging system for all RtE actions
summary: Implement a comprehensive meta-logging system that records all Right-to-Erasure actions performed, creating an immutable audit trail for compliance verification and regulatory reporting.

title: Implement selective field-level redaction for multi-user logs
summary: Develop sophisticated redaction capabilities to handle logs containing data from multiple users, ensuring only the requesting user's data is removed while preserving other users' information.

title: Create role-based access controls for legally retained records
summary: Implement granular role-based access control system for audit logs that must be legally retained despite erasure requests, ensuring only authorized personnel can access sensitive data.

title: Implement cryptographic checksums for deletion operations
summary: Deploy cryptographic integrity verification mechanisms to ensure deletion operations are tamper-evident and verifiable, providing cryptographic proof of erasure for compliance audits.

title: Build compliance team APIs for deletion operation review
summary: Develop RESTful APIs enabling compliance teams to review, approve, and track GDPR RtE deletion requests with audit trails and role-based access control.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: implementing automated RtE workflows with full deletion and partial redaction modes

title: Implement RtE compliance dashboard and reporting system
summary: Create real-time dashboard for monitoring GDPR RtE request processing, compliance metrics, and automated reporting capabilities for regulatory audits.

title: Create secure meta-log storage with access controls
summary: Implement tamper-evident meta-logging infrastructure with cryptographic integrity checks and granular access controls for audit trail protection.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: adding cryptographic integrity checks and tamper-evident meta-logging

title: Develop integration tests for ghost data persistence validation
summary: Build comprehensive test suite to validate complete data erasure across all systems, ensuring no residual 'ghost' data persists after GDPR deletion requests.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: ensuring no performance degradation during peak loads

title: Create edge case simulation and fail-loud alert system
summary: Implement comprehensive edge case testing framework with automatic alert system for multi-user logs, legal retention conflicts, and other complex GDPR scenarios.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: handling edge cases like multi-user logs and legal retention conflicts
